abstract.text: Framework for parsing design theme declarations from JSON.

inlineContent.text: is a Swift framework designed to simplify the integration of dynamic design themes into iOS applications. Utilizing JSON declarations, the framework facilitates the extraction and application of various theming elements, including colors, fonts, gradients, and shape styles, directly into the application’s user interface.
Seamlessly manage and configure themes using JSON files, enabling flexible theming without the need to modify source code.
Enables the application of linear, radial, and angular gradients to create visually appealing and dynamic backgrounds for UI elements.
Define and apply reusable shape styles, including colors and gradients, to various UI components, such as buttons, backgrounds, and custom shapes.
Automatically register and unregister custom fonts, seamlessly integrating various font types.
Ensures a uniform and customizable design system across all screens and components in your application.
De-couple design values from code by eliminating the necessity for hardcoded styling.
Supports dynamic theme switching, enabling users to adjust design values without necessitating app updates.

abstract.text: Manages gradient tokens, supporting linear, radial, and angular gradients. This enables the creation of dynamic and visually appealing shape backgrounds.
A utility for resolving tokens to their associated values.
Enum representing the supported color formats for Snapp theming.
Manages the animation declarations, ensuring that animations are mapped to their corresponding representations and configurations.
A representation of a radial gradient in the theming system.
A representation of an animation configuration for theming purposes.
A resolver that provides the tint color and disabled tint color for toggle styles.
A representation of slider style in the SnappTheming framework.
A representation of typography in the SnappTheming framework.
A container for image data with optional source URL context.
A structure representing the configuration for theming colors in the Snapp application.
Configuration for handling themed images in a SnappTheming framework.
Represents a data URI, which includes the data’s type, encoding, and the data itself.
A representation of a shape style configuration in SnappTheming framework,
which can include various gradient types.
A protocol defining the responsibilities of a theming image manager,
enabling image handling, caching, and storage for theming purposes.
A struct that holds the configuration for the overall theming system.
This includes various fallback values, encoding settings, and theme-specific configurations for colors, fonts, images, and more.
Represents different shape configurations that can be used in theming.
This enum supports standard shapes as well as customizable rounded shapes.
A protocol that defines the necessary methods for managing fonts in the theming system.
A configuration for creating a radial gradient shape style.
A representation of a linear gradient in the theming system.
A type that conditionally represents one of two shapes.
Represents information about a theming font, including its PostScript name and source data.
Representation of an angular gradient.
A configuration for creating a linear gradient shape style.
Configuration for resolving gradients in the theming system.
Representation of a shadow configuration using theming tokens.
Manages slider-style tokens, including track colors and tick mark styles for sliders utilized in the user interface.

that applies theming to the appearance of buttons.
Configuration for theming shadow.
Framework for parsing design theme declarations from JSON.
A manager for dynamically registering and unregistering fonts in theming systems.
A registry for managing image processors in the SnappTheming framework.
A type that conditionally represents one of two insettable shapes.
Manages image tokens. Supports bitmap assets for different scenarios.
Manages segment control style tokens, allowing customization of segment control appearance, including selected/unselected states, borders, shapes, and paddings.
Manages toggle style tokens, providing control over the visual representation of toggles, including color schemes for the enabled and disabled states.
A configuration object for defining button styles within the SnappTheming framework.
A struct that holds the configuration for interactive colors, including a fallback color, color format, and theme configuration.
This is used for theming interactive elements such as buttons, with specific colors for different states (normal, pressed, disabled).
A representation of toggle style in the SnappTheming framework.
A configuration structure that holds fallback values and related declarations for slider style elements such as track colors, font size, and tick mark color.
An error type representing issues encountered during theme parsing.
Configuration for theming animations.
Resolver for typography in the SnappTheming framework.
A model representing a comprehensive set of theming declarations for an application.
A resolver that contains fully resolved shadow properties for UI rendering.
Configuration for resolving typography in the SnappTheming framework.
A configuration structure for defining toggle styles in the SnappTheming framework.
Generic structure for accessing theming declarations parsed from JSON files.
A protocol defining a processor for custom image types, enabling conversion of

Manages typography tokens, combining font and size. Offers complete control over how text styles are applied within the application.
The main building blocks
A struct representing a dynamic color that adapts to system traits (light/dark mode).
It contains two color values: one for light mode and one for dark mode.
A representation of button style in the SnappTheming framework.
A configuration structure for defining the style of a segment control in the SnappTheming system.
A wrapper for
that enables encoding and decoding from external sources, such as JSON.
A utility for parsing and encoding theming declarations in JSON format.
Resolves fonts for theming purposes, supporting custom and system fonts.
A configuration structure for button style shapes in the SnappTheming framework.
A protocol that defines a shape style configuration for theming purposes.
A wrapper for theming tokens, which can either contain a direct value or reference another token via an alias.
A configuration for creating an Angular Gradient shape style.

from multiple shape expressions.
A representation of color in the SnappTheming framework.
A resolver for interactive colors, which resolves the color representations for different states (normal, pressed, disabled)

This is commonly used for UI elements that have different color states based on user interaction.

A resolver structure that holds resolved values for the segment control style such as button styles, colors, border width, and shape.

Responsible for managing and resolving color tokens, including static colors and dynamic system colors, with support for light/dark mode.

Represents an image type on macOS.

Manages button styles, including properties such as surface and text colors, border widths and colors, shapes, and typography for various button states.
Manages button shape tokens, defining the appearance of button outlines, such as circular, rounded rectangle, or custom shapes.
A path that represents a reference to another theming token.
Represents the color information for interactive states (normal, pressed, and disabled).
This struct can either hold the individual color representations for each state or a single color applied to all states.

. Useful for managing button states, toggle switches, and other interactive elements.
A manager for handling themed image caching and persistent storage.
Configuration for resolving metrics in the SnappTheming framework.
